intro: Hieracium perangustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium perangustum is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting pollinators.
